interestingFact: India is the world's largest democracy and is home to the world's oldest, continuously inhabited city, Varanasi.
The U.S. has the world's largest economy and is home to the Grand Canyon, one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World.
China is the world's most populous country and has the longest man-made structure, the Great Wall of China, which stretches over 13,000 miles.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world’s oxygen and is the largest rainforest on Earth.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, covering more than 11% of Earth's landmass.
Japan is home to the world's busiest train station, Shinjuku Station, which serves around 3.5 million passengers daily.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent and has more kangaroos than people.
